_header: Mine heart hath sent about ye far and near
_description:
‘The prison of grevous displesaunce’, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 74) — three 9-line stanzas (ababbcaac) and 6-line Envoy (aabccb)

BLHar682.First Lines:
MYn hert hath sent abowt ye fer and nereFor his welwilleris frendis
                    and allyes…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…That he hath not all that he wolde desereAs in the prisoun of
                    grevous displesaunce
